result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

AMENDED

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Barak R.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. THIS CONDITION SHALL ONLY BE EFFECTIVE UPON THE EXPIRATION OF A 72 HOUR NO CONTACT ORDER.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

10:47 AM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: K. Anderson, Attorney Holly Elkin Rockow in court for State of Wisconsin, Attorney Timothy Dale Anderson in court for Benjamin D. Relyea, Defendant Benjamin D. Relyea in court. ADA Rockow recites agreement. DE pleads GUILTY to amended Ct 1 - Misdemeanor Battery. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Court accepts plea, finds factual basis and withholds entry of judgment in favor of DJOC for a period of 18 months. Court approves and signs DJOC. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct 2. Sentencing recommendations. Payment plan approved to continue. Adjourned: 11:04 AM. kma
Filed by State. kma

records.addlTxt: Filed by DA Office E. Mulhollam. arc
Status conference on June 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Barak R.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

CO: RMW , REP: Kathy Malsom via zoom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:  Holly Elkin Rockow   DF ATTY: Kaitlin Dippolito and Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Benjamin D. Relyea appeared from jail via zoom. DE has a copy of complaint. Address and DOB confirmed. Understands charges and penalties. Atty Dippolito waives further reading. Does not qualify for PD services. Given PFAC. ADA Rockow states he is not welcome at home. SW VanDrill is present. Court directs. Ms. VanDrill states possible JIPS action. Court will accept representation from the State that DE can not return home and will exercise Chapter 48 rights and put DE in temporary physical custody. Will be released from jail to custody of social worker for temporary placement.  Status conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.
